questions.text: The Aligarh Movement was started by:
questions.explanation: Sir Syed Ahmed Khan started the Aligarh Movement to promote modern education among Muslims.

questions.text: The Khilafat Movement was launched in:
questions.explanation: The Khilafat Movement was launched in 1919 to protect the Ottoman Caliphate.

questions.text: Who wrote 'Pakistan Ka Matlab Kia - La Ilaha Illallah'?
questions.explanation: Asghar Gondvi wrote this famous couplet that became a slogan of the Pakistan Movement.

questions.text: The Indian Independence Act was passed on:
questions.explanation: The Indian Independence Act was passed by the British Parliament on July 18, 1947.

questions.text: Who was known as the 'Mother of the Nation'?
questions.explanation: Fatima Jinnah, sister of Quaid-e-Azam, is known as Madar-e-Millat (Mother of the Nation).

questions.text: The Round Table Conferences were held in:
questions.explanation: The Round Table Conferences (1930-1932) were held in London to discuss constitutional reforms.

questions.text: Day of Deliverance was observed on:
questions.explanation: Day of Deliverance was observed on December 22, 1939, celebrating the resignation of Congress ministries.

questions.text: Who presided over the founding session of the All India Muslim League?
questions.explanation: Nawab Viqar-ul-Mulk presided over the founding session of the Muslim League in Dhaka, 1906.

questions.text: The Cripps Mission came to India in:
questions.explanation: The Cripps Mission came to India in March 1942 to secure Indian cooperation during World War II.

questions.text: Direct Action Day was observed on:
questions.explanation: Direct Action Day was observed on August 16, 1946, called by the Muslim League.
